title: Google, Samsung team up for mixed-reality headset and Android XR. to take on Apple's Vision Pro - Firstpost
summary:
Google and Samsung Collaborate on Mixed-Reality Headset to Compete with Apple's Vision Pro

Date: December 12, 2024 Source: Firstpost

The tech world is buzzing as Google and Samsung unveiled their big bet on mixed reality with the Android XR platform and a brand-new headset dubbed Project Moohan. This collaboration aims to challenge Apple’s Vision Pro in the race to dominate the future of immersive technology.

  • Project Moohan is slated for a 2025 launch.
  • The headset integrates advanced features like eye tracking, hand tracking, and voice control.
  • It is powered by Qualcomm’s Snapdragon XR2 chip.
  • The Android XR platform focuses on a customizable interface and seamless integration with existing Google services.
  • Collaborators include Adobe, Calm, and Major League Baseball.
“With big-name collaborators like Adobe, Calm, and Major League Baseball already on board, the groundwork is being laid for a robust XR ecosystem.”

The collaboration between Google and Samsung has the potential to redefine digital interactions through mixed reality, though it remains to be seen if they can successfully compete with Apple's Vision Pro.
newTitle: Google and Samsung Collaborate on Mixed-Reality Headset to Compete with Apple's Vision Pro

title: False news of Luigi Mangione suicide was generated by AI; BBC complains to Apple - The Hindu
summary:
False news of Luigi Mangione suicide was generated by AI; BBC complains to Apple

Date: December 16, 2024
Source: The Hindu

The BBC has lodged a complaint with Apple regarding a false notification generated by AI, which claimed that Luigi Mangione had attempted suicide. This misleading information emerged amidst the ongoing coverage of the UnitedHealthcare CEO shooting incident attributed to Mangione.

  • AI-generated news notification falsely reported Luigi Mangione's attempted suicide.
  • The notification caused panic and confusion online.
  • This incident has brought attention to the issue of misinformation from AI.
  • BBC is in discussions with Apple about the incident.
  • The UnitedHealthcare CEO was shot on December 4, 2024.
“BBC News is the most trusted news media in the world. It is essential to us that our audiences can trust any information or journalism published in our name.”

The incident raises concerns over the reliability of AI-generated content and its impact on public perception and trust in news sources.
newTitle: False news of Luigi Mangione suicide was generated by AI; BBC complains to Apple

title: iPhone 17 Air to Be Priced Below Pro Models; Apple to Launch Foldable iPhone in 2026: Report - Gadgets 360
summary:
A Foldable iPhone May Debut in 2026: Report

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Wall Street Journal

Apple is reportedly developing two foldable devices, including a foldable iPhone, aimed for a 2026 release, with plans to cut costs on the new iPhone 17 Air model.

  • The iPhone 17 Air is expected to be thinner and priced lower than the Pro models.
  • Apple is focusing on simplified camera features to keep costs down.
  • The iPhone 17 Air may feature a 48-megapixel single rear camera.
  • Two foldable devices are in development: a foldable iPhone and a foldable laptop replacement.
  • The foldable devices could face delays in release due to design challenges.
“Apple executives were planning a 2026 release for the foldable devices but might delay the launch by up to a year to address any potential challenges.”

This development reflects Apple's ongoing efforts to innovate in the smartphone market while addressing pricing and design complexities.
newTitle: An easy to read and interpret title for the article as a string.

title: iPhone 17 Air rumoured to debut at a lower price than Pro models - India Today
summary:
iPhone 17 Air Rumored to Launch at Competitive Price

Published On: Dec 16, 2024 | Source: The Wall Street Journal

The anticipated iPhone 17 Air is rumored to debut in 2025 at a price point similar to that of the iPhone 16 Plus, contradicting earlier speculations of it being a premium offering.

  • The iPhone 17 Air will reportedly feature a slim design, measuring around 5-6mm in thickness.
  • It aims to provide a more affordable option compared to the Pro models, featuring a simplified camera system.
  • The expected pricing is around $900 (approx. Rs 76,350) in the US and around Rs 89,900 in India.
  • It may incorporate high-end features like a 6.6-inch Super Retina XDR display, 48-megapixel primary camera, and a new A19 chip.
  • The launch is speculated to occur in September 2025.
“Apple is clearly placing a strong emphasis on the ultra-thin form factor as a key selling point for its visual appeal.”

This initiative signifies Apple's shift towards creating a competitive, affordable model while still attracting users with top-tier specifications.
newTitle: iPhone 17 Air Rumored to Launch at Competitive Price

summary:

Date: Not specified | Source: Not specified

Redmi has unveiled its new Note 14 Pro+ smartphone, featuring a sleek design and impressive specifications. With a substantial 6200 mAh battery and a lightweight build, this device aims to attract users looking for an upgrade.

  • Redmi Note 14 Pro+ showcases a premium design, including a central camera module with a diamond-cut metallic ring.
  • The device is available in three colors, including Phantom Purple with a vegan leather finish, and weighs just above 200 grams.
  • It offers a 6.67-inch 3D Curved AMOLED display with a brightness peak of 3000 nits.
  • The rear camera setup includes a 50MP primary lens, a 50MP telephoto lens, and an 8MP ultra-wide lens, excelling in low light.
  • Powered by the Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 chipset, it offers up to 12GB RAM and 512GB storage.
  • The device also features a 90W fast charger for quick power-ups.
“The Note 14 Pro+ hits the right notes with its monster battery and premium design.”

In conclusion, the Redmi Note 14 Pro+ packs a wealth of features aimed at providing a compelling upgrade option for users in the competitive mid-range smartphone market.

title: ‘Kalaari Capital has seen more than $100 million in exits this year’ | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Kalaari Capital Exceeds $100 Million in Exits in 2023

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Mint

Kalaari Capital, led by Vani Kola, has reported over $100 million in exits during the current calendar year, while also investing around $25 million in more than 10 companies.

Key investments this year include Clean Electric, Lxme, Kindlife, Figr, and Convin. Kola highlighted that the firm has achieved an average of over 4x DPI return for some of its funds, with expectations of 5-6x returns for older funds.

  • Kalaari Capital has achieved over $100 million in exits in 2023.
  • Invested approximately $25 million in more than 10 companies this year.
  • Notable investments include Clean Electric, Lxme, Kindlife, Figr, and Convin.
  • Expectations of 5-6x returns for older funds.
“On an average, some of our funds have given over 4x DPI already.” - Vani Kola

This achievement reflects Kalaari Capital's position in the venture capital space and its potential for future growth.
newTitle: Kalaari Capital Exceeds $100 Million in Exits in 2023

title: Not everything is perfect with Apple: Its AI tool Apple Intelligence messes up big time, generates false - The Economic Times
summary:
Apple's AI Tool Generates False News Alert: What Happened?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Economic Times

Tech giant Apple is under scrutiny following an incident where its AI service, Apple Intelligence, generated a misleading alert claiming that murder suspect Luigi Mangione had shot himself. The notification has raised concerns about the reliability of AI in news delivery.

The False Alert: What Happened?

BBC subscribers in the UK received a notification stating, “Luigi Mangione shoots himself,” which was incorrect as he is currently in custody awaiting extradition.

How Apple Intelligence Got It Wrong

The AI service misinterpreted news context, leading to the erroneous alert. The BBC clarified that they had not published such information and contacted Apple about the issue.

Apple’s Response and Concerns

A company representative acknowledged concerns about the potential harm to credibility of both Apple and news organizations, highlighting past errors with AI summaries.

The Case of Luigi Mangione and Its Media Sensitivity

Luigi Mangione is charged with the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, making the error particularly sensitive and potentially damaging to public trust in news.

“We take our credibility very seriously,” the BBC spokesperson emphasized.
newTitle: Apple's AI Tool Generates False News Alert: What Happened?

title: Pixel 10 reportedly using MediaTek modem as Google strives for better battery & heat - 9to5Google
summary:
Pixel 10 Reportedly Using MediaTek Modem for Improved Battery and Thermal Performance

Publication Date: November 8, 2024   Source: 9to5Google

Google is set to enhance the performance of its upcoming Pixel 10 by incorporating a new MediaTek modem, departing from the previous Samsung modem which faced issues with heating and signal strength.

  • The Pixel 10 will utilize the MediaTek T900 modem, based on the unreleased “M85” generation.
  • Previous Pixel models faced overheating issues stemming from the Samsung modem.
  • Google has acknowledged that modem performance has led to higher return rates for Pixel phones.
  • MediaTek’s modem is anticipated to improve efficiency and battery life, although performance comparisons to Qualcomm's modems are yet undisclosed.
“Tensor overheating problems have been the single biggest reason for people returning Pixel phones.”

The shift to a MediaTek modem reflects Google's focus on improving user satisfaction by addressing performance shortcomings in the Pixel line.
newTitle: Pixel 10 Reportedly Using MediaTek Modem for Improved Battery and Thermal Performance
